comments.body: Yes, I was wondering if it was perhaps too laborious for folks to choose from a long list of labels (esp since the issue template doesn't list them) but I'm happy to add them all.

@guineveresaenger -- We use the following language in https://git.k8s.io/contributors/guide/release-notes.md:
> For pull requests that require additional action from users switching to the new release, include the string "action required" (case insensitive) in the release note:
>
>    ```release-note
>    action required: your release note here
>    ```

Does `action required: ` need to be prepended to the note or can it be anywhere? I don't know and was confused about where it should go, so if it needs to be prepended, let's be explicit about the language i.e., `s/include/prepend`
Given @cjwagner's feedback on Slack, looks like the relnote only needs to contain the phrase and the location shouldn't matter, so I'm happy now :)

comments.body: I have tried to please everyone by making it more obvious what is an instruction (in the markdown comment) and saying below that the author must delete the comment.

comments.body:
How about "(If an expanded release note is not needed, this entire block may be deleted)"

Also you've got <!-- comments around the entire list.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +2,6 @@Checklist for submitting a Pull Request

Please remove this comment block before submitting.

1. Please read our [contributor guidelines](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comments.body: Hi @david-mcmahon , yes I comment out the whole list of instructions because you don't want any of them in your final PR. I am trying to show the developer (a bit like git commit) that what is in a comment is "for you info only" and what you need to leave is just the release-note.

Oh I see, that was intentional.  Ultimately this leaves the important block (with instructions) in there, but if the developer hurries past the initial PR screen the commented block will be invisible otherwise - unless the developer presses "Edit" on that comment.  That feels a bit odd, but as I write this I'm starting to like it.  Yes, I like it.  Let's see how it works for people.

comments.body: What if someone accidentally type an unintended issue number? Thanks! @asalkeld

I cede any control I had to Mr. McMahon

On Tue, May 17, 2016 at 7:17 PM, Xiangpeng Zhao notifications@github.com
wrote:

> In .github/PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE.md
> https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/25717#discussion_r63636299
> :
> 
> > 1. Please read our [contributor guidelines](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).
> >    -1. See our [developer guide](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/docs/devel/development.md).
> >    -1. Follow the instructions for [labeling and writing a release note for this PR](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/docs/devel/pull-requests.md#release-notes) in the block below.
> >    +2. See our [developer guide](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/docs/devel/development.md).
> >    +3. If you want this PR to automatically close an issue when it is merged,
> >    -   add `fixes #<issue number>` or `fixes #<issue number>, fixes #<issue number>`
> 
> What if someone accidentally type an unintended issue number? Thanks!
> @asalkeld https://github.com/asalkeld
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you commented.
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/25717/files/448b1d2fde7bee29e49ffbd882e3a01e0b40971d#r63636299

@xiangpengzhao I am not changing the mechanism (lots of developers are already using this github feature), I am just documenting it. To answer your question it will close the issue that you do place in the message, so if it's wrong - the wrong issue gets closed (hopefully you notice and fix it manually).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +7,11 @@2. See our [developer guide](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/docs/devel/development.md).
3. If you want this PR to automatically close an issue when it is merged,
   add `fixes #<issue number>` or `fixes #<issue number>, fixes #<issue number>`
   to close multiple issues (see: https://github.com/blog/1506-closing-issues-via-pull-requests).
4. Follow the instructions for [labeling and writing a release note for this PR](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/docs/devel/pull-requests.md#release-notes) in the block below.
